Title:
Monilochaetes pteridophytophila (Australiascaceae,
Glomerellales), a new species from tree fern (Alsophila costularis,
Cyatheaceae)
Keywords:
1 new taxon, Hyphomycetes, Pteridophytes, Sordariomycetes,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
During taxonomic and phylogenetic studies of fungi on
pteridophytes in Thailand, Monilochaetes pteridophytophila sp. nov. was
collected from the scale of a tree fern (Alsophila costularis,
Cyatheaceae). The new species is introduced based on the evidence from
morphological comparison and analysis of a concatenated LSU, ITS, SSU
and RPB2 sequence data. Monilochaetes pteridophytophila differs from
extant Monilochaetes species in having darker and fewer septate
(1Â–4-septate) conidiophores. Monilochaetes pteridophytophila forms a
distinct clade basal from other species of Monilochaetes in
Australiascaceae. A detailed description and illustrations of the new
species are provided. We also provided a synopsis of accepted
Monilochaetes species.
